03_central_limit_theorem/02_normal/04_centralarea_from_x_v3

Random variable \(J\) is normally distributed with mean \(\mu = 170\) and standard deviation \(\sigma = 30\). \[J = \text{N}(170,\,30) \] Evaluate \(P\left(\big|J-170\big| < 30\right)\). In other words, what is the probability that \(J\) is within \(\pm30\) units from the mean?
